What is Ankylosing Spondylitis? Ankylosing spondylitis is an anti-inflammatory disease that over time causes vertebral bones to fuse. This fusion results in less flexibility of the spine and hunched posture. In a few cases, it may also affect the ribs, which may cause breathing difficulty.
